p.s: Description of Yersinia similis sp. nov.
Yersinia similis (si′mi.lis. L. fem. adj. similis similar, resembling, as the strains are similar to those of Y. pseudotuberculosis).
Cells are small, Gram-negative and motile coccoid rods.
Cells are catalase- and urease-positive, oxidase-negative and reduce nitrate.
Rhamnose-, trehalose- and glycine-positive, but melibiose-negative.
The specific 16S rRNA gene sequence marker is 5′-GATTTGGCAGAGATGCCTTA-3′ (position 987–1006; E. coli IUB nomenclature).
Other characteristics are listed in Tables 2 and 3.
The mean DNA G+C content is 48.3 mol% (HPLC).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 48.1 mol%.
The type strain, Y228T (=CCUG 52882T=LMG 23763T), was isolated from a rabbit in Germany.
